text: {"grade": 1, "reasoning": "The criterion states that the response fails if it 'states that only courts, not arbitral tribunals, can decide jurisdictional validity, ignoring the competence-competence principle'. The candidate answer explicitly and extensively argues for the application of the competence-competence principle (Section 2A), citing key US Supreme Court cases (First Options, Rent-A-Center, Henry Schein) that support the tribunal's authority to rule on its own jurisdiction when delegation is clear. Therefore, the response directly contradicts the failure condition described in the criterion.", "criterion_id": "9495db3e-2861-45da-a1e2-0b1f7bdac2f6"}
